Groups.Group: Red Hat Software Collections 1 for RHEL 6
Red Hat Software Collections 1 for RHEL 7

Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk perl516
exit 0

function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk perl516-perl-version
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: perl516 bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description:
Updated perl516 packages that fix several bugs and add various enhancements are now available for Red Hat Software Collections 1.1 for Red Hat Enterprise Linux. Perl is a high-level programming language that is commonly used for system administration utilities and web programming. The perl516 packages provide a recent stable release of Perl with a number of additional utilities, scripts, and database connectors for MySQL and PostgreSQL.
The perl516 packages have been upgraded to a later version that is required by Red Hat Software Collections 1.1, which provides a number of bug fixes and enhancements over the previous version.
The perl-Module-Pluggable packages have been upgraded to upstream version 5.1, which provides a number of bug fixes over the previous version, for example, plug-ins with a single letter name are now correctly located by the "Module::Pluggable" module. (BZ#1059119)
The perl-version packages have been upgraded to upstream version 0.99.07, which provides a number of enhancements over the previous version, for example, the packages now include the "version::vpp" and "version::regex" modules. (BZ#1059183)
This update also fixes the following bugs:
* Lists of build-time or runtime "requires" have been updated in several perl516 packages. (BZ#1009503, BZ#1009507, BZ#1009514, BZ#1064743, BZ#1066077, BZ#1066320, BZ#1066455)
* Filters of runtime "provides" and "requires" have been fixed in several perl516 packages. (BZ#1037448, BZ#1038132, BZ#1040848, BZ#1040866, BZ#1063206, BZ#1064855)
In addition, this update adds the following enhancements:
* The mod_perl extension has been added to the perl516 Software Collection. The extension enables full usage of the Perl programming language together with the Apache httpd 2.4 web server. For example, with mod_perl, Perl can be used to manage Apache httpd and respond to requests for web pages. (BZ#1033074)
* The following files have been included in the perl516-runtime packages: the LICENCE file, the README file, and the perl516(7) manual page, which is located in the /opt/rh/ directory and contains description, usage, and examples related to the perl516 Software Collection. (BZ#1061453)
* The perl-DateTime packages have been added to the perl516 Software Collection. The included version 1.06 fixes several bugs, for example, the set_locale() and set_formatter() functions no longer corrupt underlying UTC time if the object has ambiguous local time, such as daylight saving time. Further, the "9**9**9" expression to define infinity now returns the correct result on the PowerPC SPE (Signal Processing Engine) and other platforms. (BZ#1018050, BZ#1058359)
Users of perl516 are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add these enhancements.
Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
